title: Ant Moves Ahead With Credit-Scoring Company
sub_head: Jack Ma’s fintech giant will partner with state-owned companies from Zhejiang province to establish Qiantang Credit Reporting
body:
Ant Group Co.’s application to set up a credit-scoring company with state-owned shareholder partners has started being processed by the People’s Bank of China, as the financial-technology giant continues to press ahead with its restructuring.
The Chinese central bank on Friday announced details for the planned company, in which Ant holds a 35% stake. Zhejiang Tourism Investment Group, controlled by the provincial government of Zhejiang, owns another 35%. Two Ant executives together hold 10% via a limited partnership. Three other Zhejiang-based companies own the rest.
